pros: Some excellent, hardworking instructors and frontline employees who keep the rest of the institution from coming unglued. I have met some of the best people here.
cons:
Disciplinary issues with instructors who have ironclad union leads to petty feuds and subpar education for top dollar. 

HR Department is impotent and unable to take on tough disciplinary cases. Bullying and intimidation runs rampant throughout the institution with numerous enablers and bullies promoted to positions of leadership. 

Leadership doesn't always know what staff does before letting them go. This leads to cancelled agreements, broken fiscal deadlines, unnecessary and exorbitant student fees, and partnerships ending badly. There are often no succession plans when people are let go, due to instant dismissal followed up by security escorting them off property. Much of the overtime worked by support staff is damage control due to this. This happens too regularly and is demoralizing for those who remain. 

Dragging the names of former employees through the mud to absolve any in house responsibility is a typical trait of middle management at Olds College. Some leaders even share the gory details with other departments when they have fired someone.

There is no opportunity for advancement. Olds College would rather hemorrhage budget money to recruit a new leader than promote a frontline staff member with proven loyalty and ability. There are a few exceptions to this, but not nearly enough.

pros:
Olds College has a culture that has the courage to change. It readily embarks on new ways, adopts change and innovates.
The College has often promoted from within, so there are good career growth opportunities.
cons: Your department may be small and have limited resources - simply due to the fact that it is a small College. You will be expected to be broad & flexible in your abilities and tasks.

review_title: stressful, never stop being challenged, burnout and invigorating at the same time
pros: challenging, good wages, a lot of independent work, opportunities are good,
cons: burnout stress, no leadership or belief in their people

pros: Good work /life balance,  excellent employee wages and benefits.
